inclusion.criterion: Established metastatic vertebral bony disease in the spine
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: The tumor is located in the T-L spine, unresectable anaplastic astrocytoma s/p radiation.

inclusion.criterion: Eligible for single level vertebral osteoplasty (i.e. percutaneous vertebroplasty, kyphoplasty)
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Patients who are symptomatic with axial pain from vertebral metastatic involvement and are at risk for pathologic fracture; or have had a symptomatic pathologic fracture
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: Patient has severe lower extremity weakness and urinary retention s/p Foley catheter, high-dose steroids, hypertension, and chronic pain.

inclusion.criterion: Patients who have shown radiographic progression and/or pain symptoms of a documented vertebral metastasis despite non-surgical therapies
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: The tumor is located in the T-L spine, unresectable anaplastic astrocytoma s/p radiation.

exclusion.label: triggers
exclusion.evidence: Patient has progressive lower extremity weakness and urinary retention

exclusion.label: triggers
exclusion.evidence: MRI showed a spinal cord conus mass which was biopsied and found to be anaplastic astrocytoma.

exclusion.criterion: Anticipated life expectancy of less than twelve weeks to live
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: Life expectancy not mentioned, but patient has progressive neurological compromise and spinal canal compromise/neurologic compression.
